critique: This document primarily concerns the transfer of statistical policy functions from the Office of Management and Budget to the Department of Commerce. It establishes a Statistical Policy Coordination Committee and outlines the responsibilities of the Secretary of Commerce and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget in relation to statistical services. There is no direct impact on immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The order does not explicitly expand or restrict executive power but rather reassigns responsibilities. It doesn't seem to strongly favor either state or federal control, but it does create a federal committee. There's no clear indication of economic regulation or deregulation. The ideological tilt is neutral, as it focuses on administrative functions rather than policy stances.
